images.copyright: Road to Mount Pico, Portugal (© Marco Bottigelli/Getty Images)
images.title: The road less taken
images.caption: Mount Pico, Portugal
images.desc: At almost 8,000 feet above sea level, Mount Pico is the highest point in the Azores, a collection of volcanic islands in the Atlantic Ocean that are an autonomous region of Portugal. Back in 1562, an eruption here on Pico Island lasted for more than two years, but this stratovolcano has been lying dormant since 1720.
